definitions: To request that someone come to a particular place, especially for a specific purpose.
To contact a place by telephone, especially a workplace, to report something or get information.
To withdraw something, especially money or a product, from circulation or use.
examples: The company had to call in an expert to fix the server.
She decided to call in sick today.
The bank will call in all outstanding loans by the end of the year.
The manufacturer had to call in the defective products.
